A

Adds the events created in the Config class to the the simulator.

getNextHop(int) - Method in interface RoutingAlgorithm

M

main function called from the command line with one argument which is the configuration file.

Main loop of the simulator that runs through all the tasks at each time step.
movePackets() - Method in class Link
If the link is up moves the packets from the out queue of one end to the in queue of the other end.

The Payload class that represents the payload of a packet.
Payload() - Constructor for class Payload
The Payload constructor.
processRoutingPacket(Packet, int) - Method in interface RoutingAlgorithm
Given a routing packet from another router, process it (unless the interface is down) and update the routing table.

Q

queueLength(int, boolean) - Method in class Link

R

recv(int) - Method in class Router
Receives a packet on the interface specified, if no packet is available null is returned.
Router - Class in <Unnamed>
The Router class represents a router.
Router(int, int, String, int, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class Router
Router constructor takes the router id, the number of interfaces, the class name of the routing algorithm to load and the update interval, in addition to two flags indicating the level of optimisation.
ROUTING - Static variable in class Packet
A Routing Packet
RoutingAlgorithm - Interface in <Unnamed>
The RoutingAlgorithm interface should be implemented by any class whose instances are intended to provide the routing algorithm.
RoutingPacket - Class in <Unnamed>
The RoutingPacket constructor.
RoutingTableEntry - Interface in <Unnamed>
 

S

send(Packet) - Method in class Router
Sends a packet, this method just calls the more complex send method below with an arguement -3 for the interface signifying that the packet is routed using the routing table.
send(Packet, int) - Method in class Router
Sends a packet, either directly on an interface (if the interface is specified as a value other than -3) or looks the interface up in the routing table.

T
